channel.title: Vegan on Loving my tummy
channel.description: Recent content in Vegan on Loving my tummy

item.title: Baticate
item.description: 1 serving. Cut, peel and pit the avocado. We recommend cutting the avocado in half and removing the flesh with a large spoon. Cut it into chunks and place it in a bowl where you are going to beat it. Add the milk, sweetener, and cinnamon. If you want to try it with banana, now is the time to add it too. Whisk everything together (carefully so it doesn’t splash). Tips: If you find it too thick or liquid, you can correct it by adding more milk or avocado.

item.title: Blueberries & banana crumpets
item.description: Mash the bananas, add the flour and baking powder, and knead well. Add the blueberries and continue kneading until you get a moldable dough. Divide the dough into 4 equal pieces, flatten the balls, and cook them in a covered pan over medium-low heat for 4 minutes on each side. From Instagram @recetassaludables_faciles.

item.title: Cajun fries
item.description: Prepare the potatoes: Wash, dry, and cut the potato into 1/4" strips. Toss them in peanut oil until evenly coated. Air fry: Cook in an air fryer at 200°C (400°F) for 15 minutes until golden brown. Seasoning blend: Mix all the remaining ingredients into a cajun seasoning blend. Toss with spices: Toss the fries with 1/2 to 3/4 of the seasoning blend. Return them to the air fryer for 4-6 minutes at 200°C (400°F).

item.title: Carrot & Coconut balls
item.description: Cut the carrots into slices and boil them with a little water for about 20 minutes until they are soft. Drain them well and let them cool. Once they are cool, mash them well with a fork until you get a thick purée. In a bowl, mix the mashed carrots with the shredded coconut until you get a smooth mixture. Crumble magdalenas or sponge cake into the mixture, enough to give the dough some consistency so it can be formed into balls.

item.title: Cauliflower steaks with roasted red pepper & olive salsa
item.description: Unlock the flavours of cauliflower with a red pepper, olive and caper salsa, topped with almonds. Healthy and vegan, it makes a tasty light lunch or supper. Heat oven to 220C/200C fan/gas 7 and line a baking tray with baking parchment. Slice the cauliflower into two 1-inch steaks – use the middle part as it’s larger, and save the rest for another time. Rub the paprika and 1⁄2 tbsp oil over the steaks and season.

item.title: Chocolate & Banana bar
item.description: Place the banana slices on a board or tray lined with parchment or baking paper. Add the peanut butter, then the nuts (e.g., peanuts, almonds, pistachios,…) on top, and finally the melted chocolate. You can sprinkle some salt or more nuts on top as decoration. Freeze for at least 1 hour. Cut it in pieces. Storage Store in the freezer in an airtight container or plastic bag. It lasts 3 to 4 months!

item.title: Crispy gnocchi
item.description: In a bowl, add the gnocchi, spices, salt, and oil, and mix well. Place the gnocchi in the air fryer. Set the air fryer to 180-200°C (350-400°F) for 15-20 minutes. Halfway through the cooking time, shake the gnocchi to ensure even cooking. From Instagram @fussimonsi.

item.title: Garlic mushrooms
item.description: Wash and slice the mushrooms into thick slices. Mix them with garlic, parsley, chili pepper, oil, and salt. Preheat your air fryer. Cook them at 190°C (375°F) for 10 minutes (halfway through cooking, open the air fryer and stir them). Similar recipes: Instagram @misrecetasairfryercosori Instagram @pilpileando_con_guille

item.title: Gohan (Japanese rice)
item.description: Use round or bomba rice (avoid basmati or long-grain rice). Measure the rice and place it in a pot. Add plenty of water to the pot, stir quickly 2 or 3 times, and then discard the water. Add water again and wash the rice by hand, repeating this process 3-6 times (or until the water runs clear), and discarding the water each time. Add an equal amount of water to the washed rice, cover with a lid, and if you have time, I recommend letting the rice soak for 30 minutes.

item.title: Mini Chocolate Tartlets
item.description: For 2 small tartlets. Combine the cornflakes with the melted chocolate. Press the mixture firmly into two pre-greased mini tart molds to form the base. Chill in the fridge for 20 minutes. Fill the tarts with peanut butter and sprinkle chopped walnuts on top. Finally, cover with more melted chocolate (use as much as chocolate as needed). Let them cool in the fridge. From Instagram @levartenutricion.

item.title: Outback Blooming Onion
item.description: Prepare the Onion: Keep the root of the onion intact to hold it together. Slice off the top and peel the outer layer. Place the onion face down and cut it into quarters, then quarter it again once or twice more, depending on the size of the onion. Soak in ice water: Let the cut onion sit in ice water for a few minutes. This helps the layers separate and gives the onion a crisp texture.

item.title: Piquillo peppers
item.description: Prepare the Garlic and Parsley: Finely mince the garlic and chop the parsley. Assemble the Peppers: Place the drained piquillo peppers on a serving plate. Season: Sprinkle the minced garlic and chopped parsley evenly over the peppers. Dress with Olive Oil: Drizzle the olive oil generously over the peppers, making sure each pepper is coated. Add salt to taste. Marinate and Serve: Let the peppers sit for about 10-15 minutes to allow the flavors to blend.

item.title: Sevillian-style spinach with chickpeas
item.description: Prepare the Spinach: If using fresh spinach, wash and blanch it briefly in boiling water, then drain. If using frozen spinach, thaw and drain well. Toast the Garlic: Heat a skillet over medium heat with olive oil. Fry the garlic cloves until golden but not burnt. Cook the Spinach and Chickpeas: In the skillet, add a bit more olive oil if necessary. Add the spinach and chickpeas and sauté for a few minutes.

item.title: Spaghetti Aglio e Olio
item.description: Cook the spaghetti: Bring a large stockpot of generously-salted water to a boil. Add spaghetti and cook until nearly al dente (like, just one minute shy of being done). Sauté the garlic: Meanwhile, about 3 minutes after you add the pasta to the boiling water, heat the olive oil in a large sauté pan over medium heat. Add the sliced garlic and crushed red pepper flakes and sauté for 3 to 5 minutes, or until it is lightly golden.

item.title: Stuffed mushrooms with garlic and parsley
item.description: Remove the stems and thoroughly wash the mushrooms to eliminate any dirt or sand. It’s important not to remove the skin in this case, as they could burn (especially if cooked in a pan). Take a handful of parsley and as many garlic cloves as you think necessary, depending on how many mushrooms you want to prepare. Finely chop the garlic and parsley, and let them marinate with a good drizzle of olive oil.

item.title: Zucchini Scarpaccia
item.description: Slice the zucchinis into thin rounds using a mandoline or a knife. Thinly slice the onion into julienne strips. Place the zucchinis and onion in a colander over a deep plate or bowl. Add salt, mix well, and let it sit for at least two hours with some weight on top. Preheat the oven to 220°C (428°F). In a large bowl, add the flour and the liquid released by the zucchinis, one tablespoon of olive oil, black pepper, and Parmesan cheese if desired.
